qas.question: How many times was the Rhines bridge used during the Franco-Dutch War?
When did Louis surround the city with considerable force?
When did Louis march into the city unopposed and proclaimed its annexation?
In what year did King Louis annex Alsace?
On what date did the Franco-Dutch War start?
In what year was King Louis crowned?

context: Louis' advisors believed that, as long as Strasbourg remained independent, it would endanger the King's newly annexed territories in Alsace, and, that to defend these large rural lands effectively, a garrison had to be placed in towns such as Strasbourg. Indeed, the bridge over the Rhine at Strasbourg had been used repeatedly by Imperial (Holy Roman Empire) forces, and <a0_0>three<a0_0/> times during the Franco-Dutch War Strasbourg had served as a gateway for Imperial invasions into Alsace. In <a1_0>September <b3_0>1681<b3_0/><a1_0/> Louis' forces, though lacking a clear casus belli, surrounded the city with overwhelming force. After some negotiation, Louis marched into the city unopposed on <a2_0><b4_0>30 September <b5_0>168<b4_0/>1<b5_0/><a2_0/> and proclaimed its annexation.
